comments:
To reproduce this problem I had the following configuration:

Host Env = Eclipse pre M8 integ build

Checked out Platform UI from HEAD

Checked out org.eclipse.swt from HEAD

Compiled the above projects successfully in my Workspace using dynamic 
classpaths.

Trying to run as runtime-workbench I get the following stack:

Matthew Hatem/Westford/IBM@IRIS 
03/23/2004 03:42 AM	
To
Nick Edgar/Ottawa/IBM
cc
Jeff McAffer/Ottawa/IBM
Subject
weird OSGi related problem running on swt from head
	

	

I had a strange problem for the past hour trying to run with the latest version 
of the org.eclipse.swt inside PDE.

When I checkout org.eclipse.swt from HEAD into my workspace without synching 
with org.eclipse.swt.win32 I get the following exception when trying to run 
(see below).

Is this expected?  My primary concern here is that the actual problem is not 
obvious from the log.  There is no reference to the swt plug-in and debugging 
yielded little insight into the actual problem.  

I tried some later integration builds only to get similar results without the 
error log.  

So, the missing (or out of sync) swt fragment may be the cause of this but I 
would expect the log to indicate this somehow.  Moreover, the missing (or out 
of sync) fragment may have surfaced a somewhat unrelated/deeper problem all 
together.

Let me know what you think.  I can open a detailed bug report if you think it's 
necessary.

To reproduce, simply checkout org.eclipse.swt without checking out the swt 
platform fragment and try to run the browser demo.

!ENTRY 
reference:file:C:/eclipse3.0_m8/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.0.0/ 
0 0 Mar 23, 2004 03:31:39.776
!MESSAGE FrameworkEvent.ERROR

Sorry for the email cheese in my stack

This has been fixed for i20040324. A missing library causes a
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError, and we were not logging errors...

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 55483 ***

The original problem in bug 55483 is a different issue (although it has the same
result - no feedback in the log on the original problem).

The bug was reported by the originator earlier by mail, and fixed on the same
day, on time for i200403240800.
